hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Momentum Fade on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC attempts a regime transition from NEUTRAL to BULL (price > 1.5x 30-day ATR above 50-day MA) but fails to sustain momentum (RSI(14) > 70 then drops below 60 within 3 days), a mean reversion back to NEUTRAL occurs with 85% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts often trap late momentum buyers, creating selling pressure as early longs exit. Regulatory uncertainty (MiCA, UK consultations) increases likelihood of false breakouts in neutral regimes.
entry_conditions: BTC price crosses above 50-day MA + 1.5x 30-day ATR (bull signal)
RSI(14) drops below 60 within 3 trading days while price remains within 0.8x ATR of breakout level

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.25x ATR of 50-day MA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains > 1.75x ATR above 50-day MA for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals lead to sustained bull regime (price remains > 1.25x ATR above MA for 7+ days)
